p: In agreement with previous data, in all experiments, we observed the transformation of coesite-I to coesite-II at pressures exceeding 20 GPa (Supplementary Figs. 1, 2). A close examination of the diffraction patterns collected just above 25 GPa revealed a set of reflections which did not belong to coesite-II (Supplementary Fig. 2), and therefore should be attributed to a different phase. Indexed as triclinic (space group P-1), it turned out to be coesite-III (Supplementary Tables 2– 4, Supplementary Figs. 1, 2).
